p: In regions where the condition is endemic, disease-control efforts principally centered on preventing or reducing the T. cruzi transmission cycle by vector eradication and massive blood donation screening [ 5]. However, bigger challenges remain; in particular, those associated with the changing epidemiological profile of the infection (diversity of vectors, reservoirs, and modes of transmission), being the most significant problem, the lack of effective therapies to cure the T. cruzi infection or to prevent the progression of the disease, principally in advanced stages.
